translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Tuvara
The Elder Nāgakesari’s Story
Having made a bow that was unbreakable,
I went into the middle of the forest;

analyzed: kesaram ogatam disvā  pata pattam samuṭṭhita
translated: Having seen a lion’s mane that had fallen,🔽a wing-feather that had arisen,
With both hands I picked it up,
and having placed it on my head,
I offered it to the Buddha,
to Tissa, the Kinsman of the World.
For twenty-two thousand eons,
the flower that I worshipped,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
For thirty-seven eons,
there were seven with the name Kesara;
endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical insights,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Nāgakesari recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā nāgakesariyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Nāgakesariyattherassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā nāgakesariyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽nāgakesariya therassa apadānam dutiya
translated: The Elder Nāgakesari’s Story, the second.
